block.p: Chemistry in Mideast Talks It is impossible to know exactly what is going on at the Camp David talks, but the delegation members offer a road map to the process.

Chemistry in Mideast Talks It is impossible to know exactly what is going on at the Camp David talks, but the delegation members offer a road map to the process.
PAGE 10
Spotlight on Philadelphia Philadelphia gained unsought notoriety with a suspect's televised beating, but as the Republican Convention nears, the city is trying to spruce up and stay upbeat.

Canada's Abortion War Canada, traditionally a liberal bastion in the abortion war, is gripped by a polarizing debate that has spurred violent attacks and threats.
PAGE 4
John O. Pastore Dies John O. Pastore, the first Italian-American to be elected governor and to sit in the United States Senate and a dominant figure in Rhode Island, died at age 93.

Jones and Greene Triumph Marion Jones and Maurice Greene lived up to their billing as the world's fastest sprinters by winning at the U.S. Olympic Trials.

American Scenes The reader is in the passenger seat as Larry McMurtry comments on whatever he sees or thinks in ''Roads: Driving America's Great Highways.''

New Life for Barren Plazas Public spaces at the bases of New York City towers are being redesigned to be more attractive, and lively.

If It's First Tuesday . . . Once a month around the globe, dot-com entrepreneurs and financiers meet to discuss the Internet world.

To and From Russia In St. Petersburg, the Stars of the White Nights festival reigns on the banks of the Neva River; in New York, the Bolshoi returns for the first time in 10 years.

The Canadian Rockies Not far from the crowds of Lake Louise are two magnificent and relatively empty areas: Yoho National Park and Kananaskis Country.
